contentrichtext.text: '''Alush''' ({{lang-he|אָלוּשׁ}}) was one of the places, the last before [[Rephidim]], at which the [[Israelite]]s rested on their way to [[biblical Mount Sinai|Mount Sinai]] ([[Book of Numbers|Numbers]] 33:13, 14). It was probably situated on the shore of the [[Red Sea]]. It means ''a crowd of men''. A particular event that occurred here was the story in the Exodus where [[water flowed from a rock]]. {{ExodusStation|[[Dophkah]]|[[Rephidim]]}} {{Eastons}} {{coord|28|46|N|33|24|E|source:kolossus-plwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Torah places]] {{Tanakh-stub}}
